segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 19. Brāhmaṇavagga
segments.en: 19. Brahmins

segments.pli: 183. Sutasutta
segments.en: 183. Vassakāra on What is Heard

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

segments.pli: Atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then Vassakāra the brahmin, a chief minister of Magadha, went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “Ahañhi, bho gotama, evaṃvādī evaṃdiṭṭhi:
segments.en: “Master Gotama, this is my doctrine and view:

segments.pli: ‘yo koci diṭṭhaṃ bhāsati—
segments.en: There’s nothing wrong with talking about what you’ve seen, saying:

segments.pli: evaṃ me diṭṭhanti, natthi tato doso;
segments.en: ‘So I have seen.’

segments.pli: yo koci sutaṃ bhāsati—
segments.en: There’s nothing wrong with talking about what you’ve heard, saying:

segments.pli: evaṃ me sutanti, natthi tato doso;
segments.en: ‘So I have heard.’

segments.pli: yo koci mutaṃ bhāsati—
segments.en: There’s nothing wrong with talking about what you’ve thought, saying:

segments.pli: evaṃ me mutanti, natthi tato doso;
segments.en: ‘So I have thought.’

segments.pli: yo koci viññātaṃ bhāsati—
segments.en: There’s nothing wrong with talking about what you’ve known, saying:

segments.pli: evaṃ me viññātanti, natthi tato doso’”ti.
segments.en: ‘So I have known.’”

segments.pli: “Nāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sabbaṃ diṭṭhaṃ bhāsitabbanti vadāmi;
segments.en: “Brahmin, I don’t say you should talk about everything you see, hear, think, and know.

segments.pli: na panāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sabbaṃ diṭṭhaṃ na bhāsitabbanti vadāmi;
segments.en: But I also don’t say you should talk about nothing you see, hear, think, and know.

segments.pli: nāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sabbaṃ sutaṃ bhāsitabbanti vadāmi;
na panāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sabbaṃ sutaṃ na bhāsitabbanti vadāmi;
nāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sabbaṃ mutaṃ bhāsitabbanti vadāmi;
na panāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sabbaṃ mutaṃ na bhāsitabbanti vadāmi;
nāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sabbaṃ viññātaṃ bhāsitabbanti vadāmi;
na panāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sabbaṃ viññātaṃ na bhāsitabbanti vadāmi.
Yañhi, brāhmaṇa, diṭṭhaṃ bhāsato akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ na bhāsitabbanti vadāmi.
segments.en: When talking about certain things you’ve seen, heard, thought, or known, unskillful qualities grow while skillful qualities decline. I say that you shouldn’t talk about those things.

segments.pli: Yañca khvassa, brāhmaṇa, diṭṭhaṃ abhāsato kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, evarūpaṃ diṭṭhaṃ bhāsitabbanti vadāmi.
segments.en: When talking about other things you’ve seen, heard, thought, or known, unskillful qualities decline while skillful qualities grow. I say that you should talk about those things.”

segments.pli: Yañhi, brāhmaṇa, sutaṃ bhāsato akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, evarūpaṃ sutaṃ na bhāsitabbanti vadāmi.
Yañca khvassa, brāhmaṇa, sutaṃ abhāsato kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, evarūpaṃ sutaṃ bhāsitabbanti vadāmi.
Yañhi, brāhmaṇa, mutaṃ bhāsato akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, evarūpaṃ mutaṃ na bhāsitabbanti vadāmi.
Yañca khvassa, brāhmaṇa, mutaṃ abhāsato kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, evarūpaṃ mutaṃ bhāsitabbanti vadāmi.
Yañhi, brāhmaṇa, viññātaṃ bhāsato akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, evarūpaṃ viññātaṃ na bhāsitabbanti vadāmi.
Yañca khvassa, brāhmaṇa, viññātaṃ abhāsato kusalā dhammā parihāyanti, akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, evarūpaṃ viññātaṃ bhāsitabbanti vadāmī”ti.
Atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmīti.
segments.en: Then Vassakāra the brahmin, having approved and agreed with what the Buddha said, got up from his seat and left.

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha,…

suttaplex.blurb: What we say should never go beyond what we know; but it must also be meanungful.
